Posts.EditableText: I was wondering if there is a limit to how many object / rooms you can make because the game im making will use a massive amount of rooms in the end im sure. I just want to know if I should cut back on the content and limit the hole story line. As is im using two pages of binder paper for each day and the game will be no doubt well over 1000 days if not more. I guess we will need to see but is there a known limit at all or no limit at all.
Posts.HTML:
I was wondering if there is a limit to how many object / rooms you can make because the game im making will use a massive amount of rooms in the end im sure. I just want to know if I should cut back on the content and limit the hole story line.

As is im using two pages of binder paper for each day and the game will be no doubt well over 1000 days if not more. I guess we will need to see but is there a known limit at all or no limit at all.

Posts.EditableText:
There are many limits.
The room/object limit is the highest signed integer - so 32,700 odd or something.

I think that's 32,700 rooms, then 32,700 objects... But I wouldn't know.
Posts.HTML:

Posts.EditableText: I was thinking about making a game with no point or story line meaning it just be like a rpg game but with no point you could just walk around town get a job, shop, chat, and what not but then I though about it and I dont want to make the systems. I don't have a issue making the rooms. Its the money system the time system item shop etc.

a mmorpg is like an rpg BUT:

1/ it's online. therefore other players.

2/ it's huge. bigger than any rpg. with many servers to fit all the people in.

3/ they're much more developed and free-form.
